1.title: A Mother's Day Surprise!
1.plot: Dan enlists the kids to help surprise Michelle on Mother's Day, but relying on a six-year-old and two three-year-olds may not be the best idea! Meanwhile, Michelle celebrates with her own mom, hosting a tea party with Cece and Cate.

2.title: Let's Get Healthy
2.plot: Motivated by the importance of keeping weight off their joints, the family improve their diet, but not even Dan is happy to eat vegetables! Michelle prepares for her first 5K run, and Dan encourages Jack to take part in a Little People golf tournament.

3.title: Size Doesn't Matter
3.plot: Dan & Michelle want to teach their kids size doesn't matter and it should never stop them from trying new things. Michelle signs the twins up for ballet, and she takes her first cooking class. Meanwhile, Dan wants to try something more extreme: skydiving!

4.title: Happy Father's Day, Daddy!
4.plot: With Father's Day approaching, Michelle encourages the kids to create the perfect day for Dan, with Jack covertly enlisting Dan's help to raise funds for a gift! Michelle works with her mom to improve her sewing skills in order to alter some new clothes.

5.title: What's One More Hamill?
5.plot: Michelle wonders what it would be like to have another child when her sister-in-law is expecting. Meanwhile, Jack's uncle teaches how to catch Maryland crabs.

6.title: Independence Week for the Hamills
6.plot: The kids' uncle babysits when Dan and Michelle plan a double date after reminiscing about how they met. Meanwhile, the family prepares to celebrate the Fourth of July and Canada Day.

7.title: Hamill Hustle and Bustle
7.plot: Jack turns 7 with a pirate-theme party, while Michelle prepares for a visit from old friends who have eight children, but with such a busy schedule Dan has second thoughts about taking on a project for a neighbor.

8.title: NYC, Here We Come!
8.plot: A road trip to New York City finds the Hamills following Michelle's itinerary designed to experience their visit through the children's eyes and one that concludes with an amazing event for the whole family.

9.title: Small Talk
9.plot: A look at memorable moments from Seasons 1 and 2 features answers to viewers' questions. Also: The kids get a surprise visit from their uncle; Dan and Michelle play a game to find out how well they really know each other.

1.title: Meet the Hamills!
1.plot: Follows Dan and Michelle Hamill and their three kids, all of whom are little people. Jack starts kindergarten, but Michelle worries how he'll fit in with the other children.

2.title: A Hamill Halloween
2.plot: Halloween for the Hamills means the start of a new family tradition of costumes for everyone, even Dan and Michelle. Meanwhile, Michelle thinks Jack is old enough to take on some chores.

3.title: Our Little Family
3.plot: Dan builds a small play set for Jack when he notices his son's struggles to keep up with friends on the playground, but Michelle worries about Jack playing soccer with older and bigger kids.

4.title: It's Potty Training Time!
4.plot: The Hamills mark their seventh anniversary, but Dan's gift for Michelle leaves a lot to be desired. Meanwhile, CeCe and Cate are ready to be potty-trained.

5.title: The Hamills Take on D.C.
5.plot: Michelle rarely ventures outside her hometown because everyone knows her family and she feels safe in her "bubble." Worried this is limiting the kids' views of the outside world, Dan and Michelle branch out and take their first family trip to nearby D.C.

6.title: The Twins Turn Three
6.plot: Twins Cece and Cate are turning 3! To celebrate, Michelle plans an elaborate birthday party while Dan attempts to build his daughters new "big girl" beds. With less than a week to get ready, it's a race to make everything perfect for the girls' big day.

7.title: Giving Thanks and Making Space
7.plot: Michelle takes on the challenge of cooking the Thanksgiving turkey for the first time! Meanwhile, the Hamills are quickly outgrowing their rented townhouse and consider buying their own home. The parents also try to help Jack find a new winter sport.

8.title: New Holiday Traditions
8.plot: It's nearly Christmastime, and the Hamills take a fun winter wonderland vacation to the Pocono Mountains! Michelle hopes to fill the season with new memorable traditions, and she hosts a holiday party for the family's little people friends.

imdb.plot outline: The series follows Dan and Michelle Hamill as they raise their three children, Jack, Cece and Cate. All five family members have achondroplasia, a form of dwarfism, but Michelle and Dan are committed to making sure their kids feel confident in their own skin. Viewers get an inside look into the Hamills lives from potty training and soccer games to special anniversaries and holiday celebrations.
imdb.title: Our Little Family
plot: The adventures of a little family in a big world.::joshuahide

The series follows Dan and Michelle Hamill as they raise their three children, Jack, Cece and Cate. All five family members have achondroplasia, a form of dwarfism, but Michelle and Dan are committed to making sure their kids feel confident in their own skin. Viewers get an inside look into the Hamills lives from potty training and soccer games to special anniversaries and holiday celebrations.::Discovery Studios
synopsis: The series follows Dan and Michelle Hamill as they raise their three children, Jack, Cece and Cate. All five family members have achondroplasia, a form of dwarfism, but Michelle and Dan are committed to making sure their kids feel confident in their own skin. In the first season of OUR LITTLE FAMILY, viewers got an inside look into the Hamills lives from potty training and soccer games to special anniversaries and holiday celebrations. The family celebrated the twins third birthday, and they also dressed up for the first time as a family for Halloween, setting up new traditions for the kids. In the new season, Dan and Michelle will share more of their life at home as the kids are getting older. From theme park excursions to family vacations, life in the Hamill house has never been more fun.
